answer:
[
  {"student\_id": 2, "name": "Giulia", "surname": "Rossi", "course\_name": "Machine Learning"},
  {"student\_id": 5, "name": "Luca", "surname": "Verdi", "course\_name": "Machine Learning"}
]

Explanation:
The students who are enrolled in the Machine Learning course (course\_id = 108) can be found in the 'grades.csv' file. By searching for the course\_id 108, we can find all the student\_ids that are associated with it. Then, by using these student\_ids, we can look up their names and surnames in the 'teachers.csv' file.

Here is the SQL query to get the answer:
```sql
SELECT 
    g.student_id,
    t.name,
    t.surname,
    c.course_name
FROM 
    grades g
JOIN 
    courses c ON g.course_id = c.course_id
JOIN 
    teachers t ON g.student_id = t.teacher_id
WHERE 
    c.course_name = 'Machine Learning';
```
The result of the query will be:
| student\_id | name   | surname | course\_name |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 2          | Giulia  | Rossi   | Machine Learning |
| 5          | Luca    | Verdi   | Machine Learning |
